title: Toilet
data:
A **toilet** is a [dungeon feature](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

Toilets allow the player to cure [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness"), [stunning](/wiki/Stunning "Stunning") and [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"), reduce [nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition"), [poison](/wiki/Poison "Poison") [weapons](/wiki/Weapons "Weapons"), and [dilute](/wiki/Dilute "Dilute") [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"). Notably, unlike fountains, they will not dry up when used for diluting potions, nor will they cause negative effects such as summoning [water moccasins](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)

  - [1.1 Dipping](#Dipping)
  - [1.2 Praying](#Praying)
  - [1.3 Sitting](#Sitting)
  - [1.4 Drinking](#Drinking)
  - [1.5 Breaking a toilet](#Breaking_a_toilet)
  - [1.6 Identifying amulets](#Identifying_amulets)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 See also](#See_also)

## Effects

### Dipping

[Dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip") objects into a toilet [wets](/wiki/Wet "Wet") them; this poisons edged weapons, [rust](/wiki/Rust "Rust") iron objects and rots food. Dipping potions works the same as with dipping them into a [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), though the toilet will never dry up.

- Your \<edged weapon> gets wet. You cover it in filth. Yuck!

  You dipped an edged weapon in the toilet, poisoning it.

- Your \<item> gets wet. Yuck!

  You dipped a different type of object into the toilet.

### Praying

[Praying](/wiki/Pray "Pray") while on a toilet square causes you to pray to the "Porcelain God"; if successful and you are sick, stunned, or confused, you are cured. Otherwise, nothing happens. Praying on the toilet is handled separately from normal prayer, so neither affects the other.

- You pray to the porcelain God.

  You prayed while on a toilet.

- He smiles upon you.

  Your prayer was successful; this does not affect normal [prayer timeout](/wiki/Prayer_timeout "Prayer timeout"), and you are cured of sickness, stunning and/or confusion.

- He ignores your pleas.

  Your prayer was unsuccessful; as before, normal prayer timeout is unaffected.

### Sitting

[Sitting](/wiki/Sit "Sit") on a toilet cures sickness and reduces your nutrition by 200-599 nutrition points if you are satiated. Otherwise, nothing happens.

- You sit on the toilet. You grunt.

  You sat on a toilet while satiated, and your nutrition was reduced.

- You don't have to go.

  As above, but you were not satiated, and there is no effect.

### Drinking

Quaffing from a toilet normally produces one of the following effects:

- 1/9 chance of breaking the toilet ([see below](#Breaking_a_toilet))
- 1/9 chance of creating a [sewer rat](/wiki/Sewer_rat "Sewer rat") (if they're not extinct or genocided)
- 1/9 chance of creating a [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding") (if they're not extinct or genocided)
- 2/9 chance of creating a [baby crocodile](/wiki/Baby_crocodile "Baby crocodile") (if they're not extinct or genocided)
- 4/9 chance of vomiting and losing some nutrition.

If you are [polymorphed](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into any kind of [canine](/wiki/Canine "Canine"), you have a 4⁄5 chance of simply finding the water "quite refreshing" and gaining 10 nutrition. The other 1⁄5 of the time, you will experience one of the above effects.

### Breaking a toilet

[Kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") the toilet has a 1/4 chance of breaking it: A broken toilet turns into a fountain, and has a chance of summoning 2-6 baby crocodiles.

### Identifying amulets

In SlashTHEM, amulets can be dropped down a toilet to receive a message that can be used to identify the amulet. [The list of possible messages has its own page.](/wiki/User:Bluescreenofdeath/Sinks_and_toilets "User:Bluescreenofdeath/Sinks and toilets")

## Strategy

Toilets provide a safe and unlimited way to dilute potions, which can prove invaluable in the early and mid-game. Later on, characters will generally find an [amulet of flying](/wiki/Amulet_of_flying "Amulet of flying") preferable, as then [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") (either created from a fountain or found naturally) will provide a similar but far more frequent source of dilution.

If a toilet happens to be found near a large source of high-nutrition corpses (e.g. a [giant court](/wiki/Giant_court "Giant court") or [dragon lair](/wiki/Dragon_lair "Dragon lair")), repeatedly sitting on it can allow the player to eat far more of them than would normally be possible, which can be useful for gaining [intrinsics](/wiki/Intrinsic "Intrinsic") and [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"). Furthermore, the guaranteed ability to cure sickness (including [food poisoning](/wiki/Food_poisoning "Food poisoning")) by praying is also handy, in case the player lets some of the corpses get too old.

There is little reason to quaff from a toilet, even as a dog: the effects are mostly negative, and a toilet is generally far more useful than the fountain that will be left behind once it breaks.

## See also

- [A spoiler for toilets in SLASH'EM (archive link)](https://web.archive.org/web/20080209004141/http://www.statslab.cam.ac.uk/~eva/slashem/toilets.html)

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Toilet

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

A toilet is a dungeon feature that appears in SLASH'EM and SlashTHEM.

Toilets allow the player to cure sickness, stunning and confusion, reduce nutrition, poison weapons, and dilute potions. Notably, unlike fountains, they will not dry up when used for diluting potions, nor will they cause negative effects such as summoning water moccasins.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
    • 1.1 Dipping
    • 1.2 Praying
    • 1.3 Sitting
    • 1.4 Drinking
    • 1.5 Breaking a toilet
    • 1.6 Identifying amulets
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 See also

Effects

Dipping

Dipping objects into a toilet wets them; this poisons edged weapons, rust iron objects and rots food. Dipping potions works the same as with dipping them into a fountain, though the toilet will never dry up.

Your <edged weapon> gets wet. You cover it in filth. Yuck!
You dipped an edged weapon in the toilet, poisoning it.
Your <item> gets wet. Yuck!
You dipped a different type of object into the toilet.

Praying

Praying while on a toilet square causes you to pray to the "Porcelain God"; if successful and you are sick, stunned, or confused, you are cured. Otherwise, nothing happens. Praying on the toilet is handled separately from normal prayer, so neither affects the other.

You pray to the porcelain God.
You prayed while on a toilet.
He smiles upon you.
Your prayer was successful; this does not affect normal prayer timeout, and you are cured of sickness, stunning and/or confusion.
He ignores your pleas.
Your prayer was unsuccessful; as before, normal prayer timeout is unaffected.

Sitting

Sitting on a toilet cures sickness and reduces your nutrition by 200-599 nutrition points if you are satiated. Otherwise, nothing happens.

You sit on the toilet. You grunt.
You sat on a toilet while satiated, and your nutrition was reduced.
You don't have to go.
As above, but you were not satiated, and there is no effect.

Drinking

Quaffing from a toilet normally produces one of the following effects:

  • 1/9 chance of breaking the toilet (see below)
  • 1/9 chance of creating a sewer rat (if they're not extinct or genocided)
  • 1/9 chance of creating a brown pudding (if they're not extinct or genocided)
  • 2/9 chance of creating a baby crocodile (if they're not extinct or genocided)
  • 4/9 chance of vomiting and losing some nutrition.

If you are polymorphed into any kind of canine, you have a 4⁄5 chance of simply finding the water "quite refreshing" and gaining 10 nutrition. The other 1⁄5 of the time, you will experience one of the above effects.

Breaking a toilet

Kicking the toilet has a 1/4 chance of breaking it: A broken toilet turns into a fountain, and has a chance of summoning 2-6 baby crocodiles.

Identifying amulets

In SlashTHEM, amulets can be dropped down a toilet to receive a message that can be used to identify the amulet. The list of possible messages has its own page.

Strategy

Toilets provide a safe and unlimited way to dilute potions, which can prove invaluable in the early and mid-game. Later on, characters will generally find an amulet of flying preferable, as then pools (either created from a fountain or found naturally) will provide a similar but far more frequent source of dilution.

If a toilet happens to be found near a large source of high-nutrition corpses (e.g. a giant court or dragon lair), repeatedly sitting on it can allow the player to eat far more of them than would normally be possible, which can be useful for gaining intrinsics and strength. Furthermore, the guaranteed ability to cure sickness (including food poisoning) by praying is also handy, in case the player lets some of the corpses get too old.

There is little reason to quaff from a toilet, even as a dog: the effects are mostly negative, and a toilet is generally far more useful than the fountain that will be left behind once it breaks.

See also

  • A spoiler for toilets in SLASH'EM (archive link)

rawPage:
A '''toilet''' is a [[dungeon feature]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]] and [[SlashTHEM]].

Toilets allow the player to cure [[sickness]], [[stunning]] and [[confusion]], reduce [[nutrition]], [[poison]] [[weapons]], and [[dilute]] [[potion]]s.  Notably, unlike fountains, they will not dry up when used for diluting potions, nor will they cause negative effects such as summoning [[water moccasin]]s.

==Effects==
===Dipping===
[[Dip]]ping objects into a toilet [[wet]]s them; this poisons edged weapons, [[rust]] iron objects and rots food. Dipping potions works the same as with dipping them into a [[fountain]], though the toilet will never dry up.

{{message|Your <edged weapon> gets wet. You cover it in filth. Yuck!|You dipped an edged weapon in the toilet, poisoning it.}}
{{message|Your <item> gets wet. Yuck!|You dipped a different type of object into the toilet.}}

===Praying===
[[Pray]]ing while on a toilet square causes you to pray to the "Porcelain God"; if successful and you are sick, stunned, or confused, you are cured. Otherwise, nothing happens. Praying on the toilet is handled separately from normal prayer, so neither affects the other.

{{message|You pray to the porcelain God.|You prayed while on a toilet.}}
{{message|He smiles upon you.|Your prayer was successful; this does not affect normal [[prayer timeout]], and you are cured of sickness, stunning and/or confusion.}}
{{message|He ignores your pleas.|Your prayer was unsuccessful; as before, normal prayer timeout is unaffected.}}

===Sitting===
[[Sit]]ting on a toilet cures sickness and reduces your nutrition by 200-599 nutrition points if you are satiated. Otherwise, nothing happens.
{{message|You sit on the toilet. You grunt.|You sat on a toilet while satiated, and your nutrition was reduced.}}
{{message|You don't have to go.|As above, but you were not satiated, and there is no effect.}}

===Drinking===
Quaffing from a toilet normally produces one of the following effects:

* 1/9 chance of breaking the toilet ([[#Breaking a toilet|see below]])
* 1/9 chance of creating a [[sewer rat]] (if they're not extinct or genocided)
* 1/9 chance of creating a [[brown pudding]] (if they're not extinct or genocided)
* 2/9 chance of creating a [[baby crocodile]] (if they're not extinct or genocided)
* 4/9 chance of vomiting and losing some nutrition.

If you are [[polymorph]]ed into any kind of [[canine]], you have a {{frac|4|5}} chance of simply finding the water "quite refreshing" and gaining 10 nutrition.  The other {{frac|5}} of the time, you will experience one of the above effects.

===Breaking a toilet===
[[Kick]]ing the toilet has a 1/4 chance of breaking it: A broken toilet turns into a fountain, and has a chance of summoning 2-6 baby crocodiles.

===Identifying amulets===
In SlashTHEM, amulets can be dropped down a toilet to receive a message that can be used to identify the amulet. [[User:Bluescreenofdeath/Sinks_and_toilets|The list of possible messages has its own page.]]

==Strategy==
Toilets provide a safe and unlimited way to dilute potions, which can prove invaluable in the early and mid-game.  Later on, characters will generally find an [[amulet of flying]] preferable, as then [[pool]]s (either created from a fountain or found naturally) will provide a similar but far more frequent source of dilution.

If a toilet happens to be found near a large source of high-nutrition corpses (e.g. a [[giant court]] or [[dragon lair]]), repeatedly sitting on it can allow the player to eat far more of them than would normally be possible, which can be useful for gaining [[intrinsic]]s and [[strength]].  Furthermore, the guaranteed ability to cure sickness (including [[food poisoning]]) by praying is also handy, in case the player lets some of the corpses get too old.

There is little reason to quaff from a toilet, even as a dog: the effects are mostly negative, and a toilet is generally far more useful than the fountain that will be left behind once it breaks.

==See also==

* [https://web.archive.org/web/20080209004141/http://www.statslab.cam.ac.uk/~eva/slashem/toilets.html A spoiler for toilets in SLASH'EM (archive link)]
